subject: News Summary
body:
CBSNews.com






June 19, 2007

TOP STORIES9 Firefighters Killed In Charleston Blaze
Nine firefighters died in a blaze that swept through a furniture warehouse, the mayor of Charleston, S.C., said. Witnesses
                        said the store's roof collapsed, throwing debris over about two-dozen rescue workers. Onlookers were hit with flying ash. More...Watch: 9 Firefighters Killed In Blaze
• Bush, Olmert Praise Palestinians' Abbas• Officials Confirm They Got Killer Bear
                     					| Watch• Iraqi Orphanage Nightmare
                     					| WatchU.S.Officials Confirm They Got Killer Bear
The bear tracked down and killed by wildlife officers yesterday was the one that killed an 11-year-old boy in the Utah wilderness,
                        officials said. They also said the bear probably had harassed other campers in the same spot this past weekend. More...Watch: Aggressive Bear Killed In Utah
• 9 Firefighters Killed In Charleston Blaze
                     					| Watch• Cops: Indiana Teen Shoots Cops, Kills 1• At Least 5 Dead, 5 Missing In Texas Floods
                     					| Watch• More StoriesWorldBlast Near Baghdad Mosque Kills 75
At least 75 people have been killed by a truck bomb blast near a mosque in Baghdad just two days after a curfew aimed at preventing
                        such attacks ended in the capital. Meanwhile, about 10,000 U.S. troops are hunting down al Qaeda insurgents in Diyala. More...Watch: Blast At Baghdad Mosque
• Iraqi Orphanage Nightmare
                     					| Watch• Splitsville For French Power Couple• Cuba's "First Lady" Dead At 77• More StoriesPoliticsObama: "Punjab" Memo Was A "Dumb Mistake"
Democratic presidential contender Barack Obama disavowed a memo criticizing rival Hillary Rodham Clinton's financial ties
                        to India, blaming his campaign staff for a "dumb mistake." The memo was headlined "Hillary Clinton (D-Punjab)." More...
• Bloomberg Slams D.C., Avoids '08 Questions
                     					| Watch• Panel: Missing RNC E-Mails May Violate Law• Bush, Olmert Praise Palestinians' Abbas• More StoriesHealthNew Web Site Rates Hundreds Of Sunscreens
The Environmental Working Group tells how well they ward off various harmful rays. The EWG's research head explained, on The
                        Early Show. More...Watch: Sunscreens Ranked & Rated
• Splitting Pills May Help Medication Costs• Soy Compound May Bolster Women's Bones• Steep Drop In Death Among Diabetic Men• More StoriesSciTechOil Industry Scales Back Expansion Plans 
A push from Congress and the White House for huge increases in biofuels, such as ethanol, is prompting the oil industry to
                        scale back its plans for refinery expansions. That could keep gasoline prices high, possibly for years to come. More...
• Space Station's Computers Seem A-OK• Wireless Technology Takes A Leap Forward• Global Pedophile Ring Busted
                     					| Watch• More StoriesBusinessBoeing Gets A Wing Up On The Competition
With better fuel efficiency and a roomier interior, the 787 "Dreamliner" is giving Boeing a wing up on the competition. Nancy
                        Cordes reports on how the 787 could catapult Boeing past archrival Airbus for the foreseeable future. More...Watch: Boeing's 'Dreamliner'
• Yahoo's Terry Semel Steps Down As CEO• Former Enron Broadband Exec Sentenced• Dubai Company Buys QE2 Ocean Liner • More StoriesEntertainmentParis' Prosecutor Apologizes For Accident
Los Angeles City Attorney Rocky Delgadillo's wife crashed his city-issued vehicle while driving on a suspended license in
                        2004. More...
• Tiger Woods And Wife Have A Girl• Danza To Play "The Producers" In Vegas• Michael Jackson Settles $48M Lawsuit
                     					| Watch• More StoriesOpinionFatah's Fall
The New Republic says that with the rise of Hamas in Gaza, the Bush administration must alter its tactics and make
                        a more concerted effort for peace in the Middle East.  More...Watch: Escaping Hamas-Ruled Gaza
• Lieberman Takes Heat For Iran Warnings
                     					| Watch• Andy's Personality Quiz
                     					| Watch• Maybe There Should Be A Third Party
                     					| Watch• More StoriesCBS NEWS BROADCASTSThe Early Show: Jess Cagle: When Weddings Get Crazy
Some couples are spicing up their wedding day with some of their own personal flair. People magazine features memorable marriage
                        moments in a special issue called Real Life Weddings, which is now on the stands.  More...Watch: People's Crazy Weddings

Guinness Certifies Oldest ManCBS News RAW: Japan's Tomoji Tanabe, 111, was certified as the world's oldest man by The Guinness Book of World Records.
                                    He attributed his longevity in part to avoiding alcohol and smoking.
